LanguageData.Peaceful.label: ☮ Peaceful
LanguageData.Peaceful.description:
Build a community in a sandbox environment. Major direct threats are disabled, but challenges like disease, mental breaks, and mad animals can still occur.
Recommended for:
- Players who want to learn the game mechanics with minimal pressure. - Players who just want to build. - Players who just want to relax.
LanguageData.Easy.label: ✬ Builder
LanguageData.Easy.description:
Build a community with a taste of danger. Threats appear, but they're weakened.
Recommended for:
- Players who are new to this kind of game. - Players who want to build a perfect colony. - Players who want to relax.
LanguageData.Medium.label: ☫ Medium
LanguageData.Medium.description:
There's room to grow and thrive, but it's still a dangerous planet.
Recommended for:
- Experienced strategy gamers on their first game of RimWorld. - Experienced RimWorld players who want some breathing room to pursue funny or weird goals.
LanguageData.Rough.label: ✇ Rough
LanguageData.Rough.description:
Strive to survive on a rough, tough planet. There will be triumph and tragedy.
Recommended for:
- Experienced players who want a rough story requiring skill to survive.
LanguageData.Hard.label: ✪ Savage
LanguageData.Hard.description:
Face brutal survival challenges. Even if you play well, people will die. You will need to anticipate threats before they arrive, and seek out every advantage.
Recommended for:
- Experienced players who want to struggle to survive.
LanguageData.Extreme.label: ☣ Merciless
LanguageData.Extreme.description:
This setting is designed to be unfair. Huge threats will crash upon you without mercy until your colony dies. Only choose this setting if you are happy with the drama of struggling and dying.
Recommended for:
- Experienced players who want to face a brutal, unfair challenge where even great skill may not prevent death. - Lovers of tragedy. - Digital masochists.
LanguageData.Hell.label: ☠ Hell
LanguageData.Hell.description:
Even more difficult game mode as Extreme. Increased threat scale increase the multiplier of number of enemies and compexity of bad events. Recommended for:
- Experienced players who want to face a brutal, unfair challenge where even great skill may not prevent death. - Lovers of tragedy. - Digital masochists.
